chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kou Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Assault of Child Under 16 Years of Age, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be determined within ninety (90) days.
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated September 26, 2014, $227.64 represents Restitution plus a surcharge of $22.76.

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents the DNA Surcharge.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs or any prescription drugs not prescribed.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Not to possess any firearms,  No contact with:  anyone under the age of eighteen (18) unless approved by Probation Agent; the victim, K.D.Y. or her family, except Jenny Xiong.  Not to possess any sexually explicit materials or pornography.
Submit a DNA sample.  Defendant to write a letter of apology at least two (2) pages in length to K.D.Y. within 45 days.  Comply with mandatory sex offender registry.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work release; and/or school.  May be served in Eau Claire County if at no cost to Chippewa County.
